meanings.definition: Restoring or stimulating the central nervous system.
meanings.sent1: The analeptic medicine helped wake up his tired brain.
meanings.sent2: She felt more alert and awake after taking the analeptic medication.
meanings.sent3: The analeptic tonic made his brain feel like it had just taken a refreshing nap.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was like a dormant volcano, but the analeptic eruption brought it back to life.
meanings.sent5: The analeptic treatment injected new energy into his weary mind.

meanings.definition: A drug that acts as a stimulant.
meanings.sent1: He took an analeptic to help him stay awake during the night shift.
meanings.sent2: The doctor prescribed an analeptic to boost her energy levels.
meanings.sent3: The analeptic pill was like a little cheerleader for his tired body.
meanings.sent4: Her morning coffee was her analeptic, kicking her into high gear for the day.
meanings.sent5: The analeptic medication was like a jolt of lightning, waking up his senses.

meanings.sent1: After a long day at work, she relied on an analeptic to keep her going.
meanings.sent2: The athletes used an analeptic to push through their exhaustion and finish the race.
meanings.sent3: The analeptic drink was like a magic potion, banishing all tiredness.
meanings.sent4: His determination was the analeptic that fueled his perseverance through the challenges.
meanings.sent5: The analeptic supplement was like a burst of energy, dispelling all weariness.
